revised_title: Exploring the Secretory Apparatus and Structure of the Liver
tldr: The author examines the structure and secretory apparatus of the liver, focusing on the arrangement of epithelial cells and their role in bile secretion. They argue against the existence of a lobular biliary plexus and propose that the linear arrangement of cells represents an intermediate stage in the development of primary duct tubules. The study provides insights into liver function and the process of secretion.
